feed.title: Comments on TiddlyWiki
feed.subtitle: I keep an eye out for new ideas in Wiki technology (see my post from February Looking at Wiki), and I recently became fascinated by TiddlyWiki. It is sort of a one-page client-only Wiki written completely in JavaScript and HTML. (Post continues with an analysis of this Wiki-like experiment.)

entry.title: Kevembuangga commented on 'TiddlyWiki'

link.title: In the same vein and for "heavier" stuff: http://www.kevembuangga.com/hwk/ Alas, still in Beta and Firefox only Any comments appreciated anyway

entry.summary: In the same vein and for "heavier" stuff: http://www.kevembuangga.com/hwk/ Alas, still in Beta and Firefox only Any comments appreciated anyway
entry.content:
In the same vein and for "heavier" stuff: http://www.kevembuangga.com/hwk/
Alas, still in Beta and Firefox only
Any comments appreciated anyway

entry.title: Will commented on 'TiddlyWiki'

link.title: Did you see the new version? The author of TiddlyWiki has released version 3 with many new features.

entry.summary: Did you see the new version? The author of TiddlyWiki has released version 3 with many new features.
entry.content: Did you see the new version? The author of TiddlyWiki has released version 3 with many new features.

entry.title: Don Park commented on 'TiddlyWiki'

link.title: I just posted about TiddlyWiki and found that you did the same. As I wrote, I think it has some...

entry.summary: I just posted about TiddlyWiki and found that you did the same. As I wrote, I think it has some...
entry.content: I just posted about TiddlyWiki and found that you did the same. As I wrote, I think it has some good ideas worth stealing.
